repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Continuing to Pythonize Ð¡ython documentation!

This PR Pythonizes [this](https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/tutorial/memory_allocation.html) documentation page.

Lots of process details and standardization are found here: #4187

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+from cython.cimports.cpython.mem import PyMem_Malloc, PyMem_Realloc, PyMem_Free
+
+@cython.cclass
+class SomeMemory:
+    data: cython.p_double
+
+    def __cinit__(self, number: size_t):

@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+from cython.cimports.cpython.mem import PyMem_Malloc, PyMem_Realloc, PyMem_Free
+
+@cython.cclass
+class SomeMemory:
+    data: cython.p_double
+
+    def __cinit__(self, number: size_t):
+        # allocate some memory (uninitialised, may contain arbitrary data)
+        self.data = cython.cast(cython.p_double, PyMem_Malloc(
+            number * cython.sizeof(cython.double)))
+        if not self.data:
+            raise MemoryError()
+
+    def resize(self, new_number: size_t):

commit.message: Create malloc.py and format malloc.pyx in same way
Create some_memory.py + format some_memory.pyx in same way
memory_allocation: add pure python text variant

some_memory.py: fix annotation

Co-authored-by: Matus Valo <matusvalo@users.noreply.github.com>

Goals:
â New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
â Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
â Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.

title: Pythonise Memory Allocation (memory_allocation.rst)
